meta.source_provenance: Email from noreply-public@digital-policing.co.uk to Ben Carter on 2024-11-14 (issued on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon, Sussex Police)

emails.subject_summary: Jonathan Dixon requires your assistance in a police investigation
emails.body_raw:
You have been requested by Jonathan Dixon, a Police Officer or member of Police Staff, to provide data to assist with a police investigation/enquiry.
Please click here to respond to this request. The link will expire on 28/11/2024.
emails.body: Evidence-portal request sent to Ben Carter via Digital Policing, issued on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon, Sussex Police (sent one minute after the previous).

sentence_tags.text: The link to the request will expire on 28/11/2024.
sentence_tags.notes: Second near-duplicate request within one minute; raises reliability questions of Digital Policing system.

contradiction_links.claim: Police provided a single consistent intake request at each stage.
contradiction_links.reality: Two near-identical Digital Policing requests were sent on 14/11/2024, at 11:58 and 11:59, with the same expiry date (28/11/2024).

events: Duplicate Digital Policing portal request sent on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon (case 47240214305).

damages_summary.emotional: Stress and confusion due to duplicate reminders.
damages_summary.strategic: Raises concern over evidence intake system reliability.
damages_summary.reputational: Multiple entries may portray victim as unresponsive despite duplicates.
